taxonomicnotes: Horabagrus nigricollaris was described by Pethiyagoda and Kottelatt (1994) from Vettilapara on the Chalakudy River, 26 km upstream of Chalakudy Town, Kerala, India.
rationale: Horabagrus nigricollaris is assessed as Endangered because of its restricted distribution to two locations in the Chalakudy and Periyar rivers. It has an area of occupancy (AOO) of approximately 40 km² (based on the recommended AOO estimate method of overlaying a 4 km² grid on the occupied river area; the actual river area itself is much less than 40 km²), and an extent of occurrence of 2,600 km². There is also a continuing decline in quality of habitat and ongoing threats from pollution, destructive fishing practices and exotic fish species.
evaluator: Arunachalam, M., Madhusoodana Kurup, B., Krishna , K.K., Basheer, V.S., Abraham, R. & Molur, S.
